physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Frequent, intermittent, nonrhythmic, diffuse whole-body shuddering and jerking. The activity lasted for 1 to 2 seconds and occurred every 10 to 15 seconds. The remainder of her general and neurologic examinations were normal.

Confusion, staring spells, and near-constant whole-body jerks. During 72 hours, there were periods, ranging from 2 to 12 hours, when she appeared to be fully aware of her environment. Neurologic examination was normal.
